title: Experts: Heatstroke Now Just 'advanced Hydration Strategy
excerpt: Triathletes seek 'elemental' challenges, guided by a maestro's.
content:
It appears our modern athletic paragons are no longer content with mere physical endurance; they crave a more *elemental* struggle. Enter the sage advice from a [triathlon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triathlon) maestro, who, with an air of detached wisdom, guides us through the finer points of subjecting oneself to a shimmering, asphalt griddle. The quaint notion of seeking shade, or perhaps a nice, air-conditioned establishment, is evidently for the uninitiated.

Instead, we are encouraged to embrace the sun's fiery embrace, transforming what many might mistakenly call 'dangerously high temperatures' into a rigorous, yet ultimately character-building, '[advanced hydration strategy](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/heatstroke/symptoms-causes/syc-20353581)'. One might even posit that the pursuit of [personal bests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics) now occasionally necessitates a brief, prostrate interlude on the tarmac, purely for strategic cooling. After all, what is a little [epidermal crisping](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/sunburn/) when one is chasing glory?

Original article: [5 tips for running in the heat](https://www.triathlonmag.com.au/2019/04/04/5-tips-for-running-in-the-heat/)

title: Scientists Warn Acecraft Code Misuse Could Unravel Reality
excerpt: "Video game code 'Acecraft' could potentially warp reality,.
content:
The scientific community is reportedly in a state of muted panic following the recent disclosure that specific sequences, colloquially known as "[Acecraft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game)" codes, possess a previously uncatalogued potential to warp the very fabric of existence. While these codes are currently being redeemed en masse for trivial in-game baubles like "Diamonds" and "Power Cubes," leading [scientists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist) from the Institute for Theoretical Irrelevance have issued grave warnings. They posit that the collective misuse, or perhaps even the correct, widespread application, of these digital incantations could initiate a cascade failure in our perceived [reality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reality).

Concerns escalate with each passing day of September, as millions continue to chase these fleeting digital bounties. Experts suggest that the relentless pursuit of mere virtual currency, such as the aforementioned "Diamonds" and "Power Cubes" (a term now whispered with a chilling reverence in certain academic circles), might be a symptom of a deeper societal malaise. One can only hope humanity ceases its frantic acquisition of negligible pixels before the fundamental laws governing our universe [collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collapse). It's a race against time, for some shiny bits of code.

title: DQ Remake Trailer Spends 7 Mins Explaining What "2D" Is
excerpt: Square Enix dedicates 7 minutes to defining 2D.
content:
It appears the fine minds at [Square Enix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Square_Enix) have, with an admirable if somewhat baffling dedication, committed seven full minutes of their latest trailer to meticulously defining the concept of "2D." One might have assumed that after decades of visual media, the fundamental distinction between a flat plane and the vast, three-dimensional expanse of reality would be, shall we say, *understood*. Evidently, the upcoming [Dragon Quest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Quest) I & II HD-2D Remake necessitates a comprehensive refresher course for its audience, lest they mistake a sprite for a rogue polygon.

The "extensive gameplay overview" reportedly delves into such groundbreaking topics as horizontal movement and the startling absence of a Z-axis, ensuring that no potential player of this classic saga, whether on the current [Nintendo Switch](https://www.nintendo.com/us/switch/) or its as-yet-mythical successor, accidentally attempts to walk *into* the screen. It’s a bold move, truly, to devote significant marketing effort to what most would consider foundational visual grammar, rather than, say, the riveting narrative nuances of slime combat or the profound implications of an inn stay. Perhaps the next trailer will explore the revolutionary concept of "buttons."

Original article: [Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake Gets Seven-Minute Gameplay Overview Trailer](https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/09/dragon-quest-i-and-ii-hd-2d-remake-gets-seven-minute-gameplay-overview-trailer)

In a groundbreaking move, finance departments across the globe are now required to account for the value of sandcastles in company balance sheets. This monumental decision comes as experts argue that these intricate works of art, often constructed during corporate retreats, hold significant monetary worth due to their complex designs and hours spent building them.
The new directive has sent ripples through the business world, with executives scrambling to quantify the worth of their company's sandcastles. Some have even gone so far as to hire professional appraisers to assess the value of these temporary structures, while others are considering insurance policies to protect against potential collapse or natural erosion.
While some view this development as a frivolous waste of resources, proponents argue that it's only fair to recognize the economic impact of these sandy masterpieces. After all, they reason, if cryptocurrencies can be considered assets, why not sandcastles?
As businesses grapple with this new reality, one thing is certain: the value of a well-constructed sandcastle will no longer be underestimated or overlooked.

In a startling turn of events, the peaceful suburban life of the Smiths has been disrupted by an unexpected intruder – a tractor. The relentless mechanical beast, whose owner is their neighbor Farmer Jenkins, has taken it upon itself to perform daily harvests at midday, a time traditionally reserved for marital bliss and lunch breaks.
Mrs. Smith, who prefers to remain anonymous due to the embarrassing nature of the situation, described the tractor's routine as "quite disruptive." She recounted her recent attempt to enjoy a romantic meal with her husband, only to be serenaded by the distant hum of the tractor and the sight of bales of hay being moved about.
"We tried to set the mood," she lamented, "but the tractor's unyielding engine seemed to have other plans." The situation has reached such a point that the Smiths are considering moving to a quieter neighborhood, far away from the clutches of this amorous tractor.
As for Farmer Jenkins, he remains blissfully unaware of his neighbor's predicament, happily continuing his midday harvests with nary a thought spared for the Smiths' marital woes.

In an unexpected twist of events, Hollywood heartthrob and Deadpool franchise star [Ryan Reynolds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryan_Reynolds) has come clean about the much-discussed leaked test footage that catapulted the Merc with a Mouth into cinematic glory. In an exclusive interview, Reynolds admitted that it wasn't his unparalleled cinematic intuition that led to Deadpool's success, but rather, his "lucky socks."
According to sources close to the actor, Reynolds has been known to wear a particular pair of socks during high-stakes negotiations and critical decisions. "It started as a joke," said one insider, "but ever since that fateful day when those socks were involved in the Deadpool test footage deal, Ryan's been rather superstitious about them."
The actor, who has previously joked about his ability to "make things happen" on set ([IMDB](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0582476/trivia?ref_=tt_trv_trv)), has now taken it a step further by admitting that his lucky socks may be the real MVP in Hollywood.
Fans of Deadpool, however, are not buying into Reynolds' explanation, instead seeing this as another example of the actor's self-deprecating humor and knack for creating headlines. "If Ryan says it was the socks, I'm going to believe it's the socks," one fan tweeted [@deadpoolmovie](https://twitter.com/DeadpoolMovie). "But I think he's just pulling our legs."
While we may never know the truth behind Reynolds' lucky socks, one thing is certain: Deadpool has found a perfect actor in its star and an unconventional ally in a pair of magical garments.

This venerable tactic, previously dismissed as an affront to democratic principles when suggested by the opposing aisle, has suddenly been unearthed and declared a vital instrument for efficient governance. The impetus? A rather pressing backlog of [President Donald Trump's](https://www.whitehouse.gov/archive/president-donald-trump/) most crucial, if numerically vast, lower-level appointments.

Sources close to the ongoing strategic reassessment indicate that the sudden utility of this particular alteration to [Senate rules](https://www.senate.gov/reference/resources/rules/toc.htm) became blindingly clear once its potential to expedite *their* agenda was fully grasped. One can almost hear the collective gasp of revelation: "You mean, we can just… change the rules to get what we want? Why didn't anyone tell us this before, other than, you know, everyone?" The urgency to confirm scores of assistant deputy under-secretaries and various bureau chiefs is, of course, paramount to the nation's continued operations.

title: OPEC+ To Flood Market, Agrees To Price Of Zero
excerpt: OPEC+ targets zero oil price. Your tank, now infinitely full.
content:
The venerable [OPEC+ alliance](https://www.opec.org/opec_web/en/) has, in a move baffling to anyone clinging to notions of basic economics, reportedly agreed to a monumental increase in [crude oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petroleum) output, effectively aiming for a glorious, utopian price point of precisely zero. Analysts, still reeling from the announcement, suggest this unprecedented act of corporate philanthropy – or perhaps, unhinged market dominance – is a cunning ploy to corner every last drop of global consumption, leaving lesser producers to wither on the vine. It seems the quest for [market share](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_share) has finally transcended mere profit, evolving into a philosophical statement on the ultimate value of a non-renewable resource: absolutely nothing.

Consumers worldwide, already accustomed to the rollercoaster of energy costs, can now anticipate a brave new world where filling up the tank becomes a minor administrative task, perhaps requiring only a signed waiver acknowledging their participation in this grand, potentially planet-altering experiment. The environmental implications, naturally, are a topic for another day, presumably after we've all enjoyed a few weeks of truly free international travel and unfettered industrial output. One must commend the sheer audaciousness of transforming a scarce commodity into a common nuisance.

title: Rewards Credit Cards Linked To Disturbing Lack Of Grievances
excerpt: Credit card woes lack Pulitzer potential.
content:
It’s a truly perplexing epoch we inhabit, where the greatest injustices seem to involve the intricacies of maximizing one’s quarterly spending bonus. A recent, deeply concerning report suggests a distinct paucity of genuine anguish among holders of [rewards credit cards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rewards_credit_card). Apparently, the system, while perhaps not entirely perfect, has yet to drive anyone to pen a truly scathing, soul-wrenching indictment worthy of a major literary prize.

One must recall a simpler, more robust era. Back when a working man’s daily existential dread wasn't predicated on earning optimal [travel points](https://www.nerdwallet.com/article/travel-rewards-credit-cards/travel-points). Imagine, if you will, the early 20th century. Men toiling underground, facing genuine danger, breathing the very earth they extracted for meager compensation. Their industry was, by modern standards, a festival of oversight deficiencies, often entirely bypassing the charming concept of [financial regulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_regulation) as we know it.

Where is the grit, the palpable despair, in debating whether to redeem cashback or convert to airline miles? We’ve traded the genuine, visceral terror of [coal mining](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) for the mild anxiety of a looming annual fee. This disturbing lack of profound suffering begs the question: are we truly living, or merely accumulating?

In a move widely interpreted as an innovative approach to national fortitude, party strategists are reportedly championing the view that a bit of agony during an [IUD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intrauterine_device) insertion builds an unparalleled resilience. This enlightened perspective reportedly extends to the broader medical field, with whispers of replacing anesthesia with motivational speeches.

The very notion of a "nearly painless" procedure, as explored by certain progressive medical establishments like [Planned Parenthood](https://www.plannedparenthood.org/), is now seen as a dangerous erosion of character. Critics within the [GOP](https://www.gop.com/) lament the coddling of patients, arguing that if one cannot endure a minor gynaecological inconvenience, how can one possibly withstand the rigours of modern life, let alone global economic fluctuations? A plastic model of the uterus, often used for demonstration, reportedly fails to convey the necessary "grit."

Evidently, the pathway to a truly robust nation lies not in comfortable healthcare, but in the stoic endurance of avoidable discomfort. After all, if our grandmothers could walk uphill both ways in the snow *and* experience unmedicated IUD insertions, what excuse do today’s weaker generations have?

No longer will the modern internet user suffer the existential dread of encountering an unvetted opinion, or worse, a fact that contradicts their curated worldview. This ingenious mechanism promises to streamline your information diet, ensuring every search result is a soothing affirmation of what you already suspected to be true.

Gone are the dark ages of critical thinking, where one might inadvertently stumble upon a dissenting perspective. Now, through advanced algorithms, users can meticulously craft their digital realities, experiencing an unparalleled sense of intellectual security. This innovative approach guarantees a future free from the cognitive dissonance that previously plagued humanity, paving the way for a truly harmonious, albeit singularly-minded, online experience. It’s essentially a perfectly tailored [echo chamber](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Echo_chamber), thoughtfully constructed just for you.

Indeed, the arduous task of sifting through disparate viewpoints is now graciously handled by automated systems. The digital realm has finally matured into a safe space, where inconvenient truths are neatly filed away, replaced by comforting narratives from your chosen intellectual stewards. For a deeper dive into such implications, consider reading about [information control](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_control). A brighter, more predictable future awaits.

One might assume liberal democracy now hinges upon a particular state-level nuance concerning university admissions.

Indeed, [Virginia lawmakers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_General_Assembly) have reportedly ‘thrown down the gauntlet,’ a phrase typically reserved for duels, not procedural amendments. Their noble quest? To 'save' the institution from the insidious machinations of [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump)'s alleged 'war on race' within academia. One can almost picture determined custodians, brooms in hand, ready to sweep away ideological dust bunnies, molding dissenters in the student union snack bar.

The gravity of this situation cannot be overstated; the future of American [higher education](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higher_education_in_the_United_States) apparently hangs by a thread, a thread being meticulously re-stitched by legislative decree in Fairfax. It’s a battle so monumentally significant, one almost forgets the myriad other challenges facing a nation, choosing instead this one, exquisitely niche, and presumably very marketable, front in the ongoing culture wars.

Original article: [George Mason Battle Will Mold Opposition to Trump’s Agenda](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/george-mason-gmu-battle-will-mold-opposition-to-trumps-agenda/)

title: Zelensky Condemns Attack, Expects Written Apology
excerpt: Russia's 'special' decor finally reached Kyiv's gov core.
content:
The architectural integrity of [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv)'s central administration seems to have finally caught the attention of Russia, marking a curious milestone in their rather protracted "special military operation." For the first time since the full-scale invasion began, a governmental edifice within the city's purportedly impenetrable core has been, shall we say, redecorated with external art. One might wonder what precisely constituted a "full-scale" invasion prior to this particular incident, if not the targeting of, well, the government. Perhaps they were just admiring the skyline.

President [Zelensky](https://www.president.gov.ua/en)'s subsequent condemnation of this "ruthless attack" comes with a surprisingly quaint demand: a written apology. One can only imagine the urgency with which this formal note must be penned, lest the ongoing conflict descend into utter rudeness. After all, what’s a few thousand lives and the decimation of infrastructure when compared to a glaring breach of diplomatic etiquette? Clearly, the real escalation here is the failure to properly acknowledge one's transgressions in triplicate. Perhaps the [United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/) should prepare a strongly worded letter regarding the lack of properly addressed envelopes.

Original article: [Zelensky condemns 'ruthless attack' after Russia hits main government building in Kyiv](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cpq5dl5y4nlo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)

title: Gen AI Confirms Office Air Appears To Be Breathable
excerpt: AI proves: Office fluorescents merely soul-crushing, not lethal.
content:
The latest advancements in [Generative AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence) have finally delivered what every modern enterprise truly craves: an affirmation that the office fluorescent lighting, while soul-crushing, does not emit lethal radiation. Expert systems can now 'accelerate' the tedious 'diligence process' by confirming, with unparalleled statistical confidence, that the water cooler dispenses actual water, and that the weekly 'synergy session' did indeed occur. These 'richer insights' mean [corporate boards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Board_of_directors) no longer need to rely on quaint human observation for such critical operational intelligence.

Furthermore, equipping our esteemed leadership with such irrefutable data ensures decisions are made with the kind of speed and confidence usually reserved for toddlers asserting their preference for chocolate over broccoli. This newfound clarity, derived from algorithms diligently sifting through data points such as "employee heartbeat detected near cubicle farm," promises an unparalleled [investment edge](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/investment-strategy.asp). Why ponder the nuances of market dynamics when an AI can tell you, definitively, that the stapler drawer contains staplers? The future is now, and it's brought to you by a machine validating your basic reality.

title: Amazon Redeems Rural America By Turning It Into Logistics Hub
excerpt: Erie's purpose: now available with two-day shipping.
content:
It appears the great existential quandary of [Erie, Pennsylvania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erie,_Pennsylvania) has finally been solved, not by introspection or local initiative, but by the benevolent gaze of [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/). For too long, this bewildering patch of land wrestled with its identity, flitting between aspirations of being a quaint rural idyll, a bustling port, or perhaps even a place people *chose* to live for reasons other than affordability. Now, with the arrival of sprawling distribution centers, its purpose is beautifully, gloriously singular.

No longer must residents ponder if their community is a college town, a beach town, or some fleeting fad. The future, it turns out, is a finely tuned machine, endlessly whirring with the promise of next-day delivery. This transformation, euphemistically dubbed "economic development," offers a crystal-clear path: become a vital cog in the global [logistics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logistics) network. Who needs diverse local businesses when you can have the consistent drone of tractor-trailers, symbolizing progress and the freedom to order a single toothbrush at 3 AM? Rural America, consider yourself redeemed.

Original article: [Amazon Expands Jobs and Services in Rural America](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/amazon-expands-jobs-services-rural-america/)

content:
Sources close to the administration are reportedly agog with the meticulous precision employed by [Melania Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melania_Trump) in placing the very concept of [Artificial Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) squarely in the center of a room. One can only imagine the exacting measurements, the laser-level scrutiny, ensuring no algorithm felt slighted by being relegated to a corner. This groundbreaking 'placement strategy' unfolded during a pivotal meeting at the [White House](https://www.whitehouse.gov/), where esteemed tech luminaries, presumably eager to observe such architectural genius, gathered to witness history.

The assembly, featuring the CEOs of companies whose valuations currently defy gravity, purportedly delved into the profound implications of these digital brains, though it remains unclear if any discussions deviated from the structural integrity of the 'center' or the optimal feng shui for innovation. Whispers suggest that while the 'precision' of AI's new home was lauded, a lurking anxiety about a potential [dot-com bubble](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dot-com_bubble) redux lingered, perhaps slightly off-center, just out of the First Lady's expert purview. This seismic shift, according to early morning reports from various breakfast nooks, stems primarily from a particularly robust omelet consumed by a key staff member. [ESPN](https://www.espn.com/college-football/) analysts are already debating whether a continental breakfast or a full English will yield superior results come 2029, with some even proposing radical lunch-based strategies. title: Doctors Urge Caution With 'weekend Reads' Dosage
excerpt: Experts: Weekend reading now a top public health threat.
content:
Experts are increasingly concerned that the seemingly benign act of consuming "weekend reads" may pose unforeseen risks to public health. While the siren song of a particularly robust [Colombia Tolima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tolima_Department) peaberry might tempt one to dive headfirst into the weekend's literary offerings, medical professionals are urging a more measured approach. The ritualistic procurement of a specific artisanal brew, coupled with the strategic deployment of outdoor seating, signals an engagement level previously reserved for open-heart surgery or perhaps reviewing a minor tax reform bill.

Particularly concerning is the potential for cognitive overload when faced with truly demanding material, such as MotorTrend's groundbreaking exposé on extended cohabitation with an [electric vehicle](https://www.tesla.com/). Sources within the [American Medical Association](https://www.ama-assn.org/) suggest that such 'longer-form' engagements, while seemingly innocuous, can trigger a cascade of complex emotional responses, ranging from mild boredom to the profound existential dread of realizing one's leisure time is being meticulously managed by algorithms. Readers are advised to hydrate and perhaps consult a [psychologist](https://www.apa.org/helpcenter/find-psychologist) before embarking on any "living with" narratives that exceed three paragraphs.

Original article: [10 Weekend Reads](https://ritholtz.com/2025/09/10-weekend-reads-56/)

title: Former Xbox Execs Blame Game Pass For Slight Feeling Of Unease
excerpt: Top execs bravely confront new horror: games people can afford.
content:
The corporate world, ever a bastion of stoicism, is apparently quivering under a new, existential threat: affordable gaming subscriptions. Former luminaries from the hallowed halls of [Microsoft](https://www.microsoft.com/) and its subsidiary, [Bethesda](https://bethesda.net/en/dashboard), have bravely stepped forward to confess their profound discomfort.

It seems the relentless march of [Xbox Game Pass](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_Game_Pass) has introduced an unwelcome 'tension' into their lives. A sensation perhaps akin to a perfectly tailored suit suddenly feeling slightly off, or the caviar being inexplicably… *less*.

One former dignitary, whose departure in 2023 no doubt involved a golden parachute, decried ‘short-sighted decision-making.’ One can only imagine the horror of anticipating a slightly smaller yacht next quarter, or the existential dread of witnessing a subscription service *benefit* consumers without first extracting every last coin from their souls. Truly, a capitalist's nightmare, almost enough to threaten their [corporate profits](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Profit_(accounting)).

title: Nonsense Machine Revolutionizes Sock Sorting Simulation
excerpt: Punk devs ditch anarchy for the digital sock drawer.
content:
It appears the esteemed Australian purveyor of digital escapism, [Nonsense Machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_developer), has unveiled its latest groundbreaking endeavor: a sock sorting simulation. One might recall developer [dweedes](https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/dryft-racing-hip-hop-and-pirates:-the-cheeky,-eclectic-games-of-aussie-studio-nonsense-machine) once cultivating an image of "punkish rebellion." Now, that spirit manifests in the meticulous digital categorization of hosiery, a truly audacious subversion of, well, *anything* actually rebellious. Perhaps the true revolution lies in the exquisite banality.

This seminal contribution to interactive media will, we are assured, be available via the illustrious [WET GAMIN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indie_game_development) platform, a hallowed ground for "experimental games" that frequently push the boundaries of player endurance. To "revolutionize" a [sock sorting simulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simulation_game) is a bold claim, suggesting future updates might include virtual stain removal or the existential dread of finding a lone sock. A "cheeky" pivot from racing and pirates to the domestic drudgery we all secretly crave, apparently.

All eleven surviving titans of the 2008 [U.S. Olympic men's basketball team](https://www.teamusa.org/USA-Basketball/Men) were reportedly present, demonstrating an unflinching dedication to value that truly speaks to their championship pedigree.

While ostensibly assembled for their enshrinement into the [Basketball Hall of Fame](https://www.hoophall.com/) and to pay respects to their late teammate [Kobe Bryant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobe_Bryant), sources suggest the promise of unlimited, free, cheesy goodness was a significant, if unspoken, motivating factor. One can only imagine the gravitas in the air as these millionaire athletes, moments after solemn tributes, meticulously selected their jalapeño count.

Indeed, it seems the ultimate redemption for these legends wasn't merely a gold medal, but the sweet, salty satisfaction of a zero-dollar snack. A true testament to the enduring human spirit, or perhaps just the sheer magnetic pull of free provisions, even for those who could buy the entire concession stand.

title: GOP: IUD Pain Must Reflect Seriousness Of Sin
excerpt: GOP questions IUD comfort. Suffering builds character.
content:
It appears certain factions within the [Republican Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States)) are growing increasingly uneasy with the medical community’s relentless pursuit of, shall we say, *comfort*. Specifically, the ongoing efforts to minimize the discomfort associated with the insertion of an [intrauterine device](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intrauterine_device) have raised eyebrows, perhaps even temperatures, in circles where suffering is often perceived as a spiritual cleansing. One might infer that any procedure designed to reduce physical agony for women engaging in [reproductive healthcare](https://www.plannedparenthood.org/blog/what-is-reproductive-health-and-what-services-does-it-include) is fundamentally undermining a crucial, if unwritten, tenet of moral instruction.

Indeed, the very notion of a "nearly painless" IUD placement seems to defy a peculiar logic suggesting that the magnitude of perceived moral transgression should be directly proportional to the physical discomfort experienced. How, one wonders, can one truly repent when one hasn't adequately endured? The insidious introduction of educational plastic models, allowing doctors to demystify and simplify the process, further compounds this problem, removing any last vestige of punitive mystery. Where, oh where, is the appropriate level of somber reflection if a procedure is reduced to mere clinical efficiency, devoid of character-building agony? One shudders to think what this could mean for the future of [medical ethics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_ethics), or rather, their unique interpretation of it.

Original article: [There’s a Secret to a Nearly Painless IUD. Republicans Can’t Stand It.](https://slate.com/technology/2025/09/iud-placement-abortion-provider-planned-parenthood-trump.html?via=rss)
